pageContext.claim: “We used to take the straits, and everybody else benefited. We'd keep them clear so that other countries could take oil from the Middle East, and nobody paid us. Now they're starting to pay us a lot of money, folks.”
pageContext.analysis: There’s no apparent evidence countries are paying the U.S. to keep the Strait of Hormuz open. A series of military chess moves have occurred in and around the straight in recent months.
